Name: Isaac Newton
Contribution: Formulated the laws of motion and universal gravitation
Likely MCQ: Q: Who formulated the laws of motion? A) Albert Einstein B) Isaac Newton C) Michael Faraday D) Niels Bohr (Ans: B)
Tip/Suggestion: Associate Newton with 'apple'—his laws of motion and gravitation were inspired by a falling apple.

Name: Albert Einstein
Contribution: Developed the theory of relativity ($E=mc^2$) and explained the photoelectric effect
Likely MCQ: Q: The equation $E=mc^2$ is associated with: A) Isaac Newton B) Albert Einstein C) J.J. Thomson D) Ernest Rutherford (Ans: B)
Tip/Suggestion: Remember Einstein with 'energy'—$E=mc^2$ links energy and mass.

Name: Michael Faraday
Contribution: Discovered electromagnetic induction
Likely MCQ: Q: Who discovered electromagnetic induction? A) Michael Faraday B) James Maxwell C) Heinrich Hertz D) Andre Ampere (Ans: A)
Tip/Suggestion: Link Faraday with 'field'—his work on electromagnetic fields led to generators and transformers.

Name: James Clerk Maxwell
Contribution: Formulated the classical theory of electromagnetic radiation
Likely MCQ: Q: Who unified electricity and magnetism into electromagnetic theory? A) Michael Faraday B) James Maxwell C) Nikola Tesla D) Thomas Edison (Ans: B)
Tip/Suggestion: Maxwell = 'maximum'—he gave the maximum contribution to electromagnetic theory.

Name: Niels Bohr
Contribution: Proposed the Bohr model of the atom with quantized energy levels
Likely MCQ: Q: The scientist who proposed the model of the atom with electrons in discrete energy levels is: A) J.J. Thomson B) Ernest Rutherford C) Niels Bohr D) Werner Heisenberg (Ans: C)
Tip/Suggestion: Bohr sounds like 'bore'—his model bored into the atom’s structure with energy levels.

Name: Ernest Rutherford
Contribution: Discovered the atomic nucleus through the gold foil experiment
Likely MCQ: Q: Who discovered the atomic nucleus? A) Niels Bohr B) Ernest Rutherford C) J.J. Thomson D) Albert Einstein (Ans: B)
Tip/Suggestion: Rutherford = 'ruthless'—he ruthlessly scattered alpha particles to find the nucleus.

Name: J.J. Thomson
Contribution: Discovered the electron and proposed the plum pudding model of the atom
Likely MCQ: Q: The scientist who discovered the electron is: A) J.J. Thomson B) Ernest Rutherford C) Niels Bohr D) Robert Millikan (Ans: A)
Tip/Suggestion: Thomson = 'thom' sounds like 'atom'—he found the electron, a key part of the atom.

Name: Heinrich Hertz
Contribution: Confirmed the existence of electromagnetic waves
Likely MCQ: Q: Who experimentally confirmed electromagnetic waves? A) James Maxwell B) Heinrich Hertz C) Michael Faraday D) Andre Ampere (Ans: B)
Tip/Suggestion: Hertz = 'Hz'—the unit of frequency, as he confirmed electromagnetic waves like radio waves.

Name: Andre-Marie Ampere
Contribution: Formulated Ampere’s law, foundational to electromagnetism
Likely MCQ: Q: Ampere’s law in electromagnetism is named after: A) Michael Faraday B) Andre Ampere C) James Maxwell D) Heinrich Hertz (Ans: B)
Tip/Suggestion: Ampere = 'amp'—think of electric current, as his law relates current to magnetic fields.

Name: Hans Christian Oersted
Contribution: Discovered that electric currents produce magnetic fields
Likely MCQ: Q: Who discovered that electric currents produce magnetic fields? A) Hans Oersted B) Andre Ampere C) Michael Faraday D) James Maxwell (Ans: A)
Tip/Suggestion: Oersted sounds like 'orsted'—think 'orbit' of magnetic fields around a current-carrying wire.

Name: Wilhelm Rontgen
Contribution: Discovered X-rays
Likely MCQ: Q: The scientist who discovered X-rays is: A) Wilhelm Rontgen B) Marie Curie C) Ernest Rutherford D) J.J. Thomson (Ans: A)
Tip/Suggestion: Rontgen = 'rays'—he discovered X-rays, used in medical imaging.

Name: Marie Curie
Contribution: Discovered radioactivity along with Pierre Curie
Likely MCQ: Q: Who is credited with the discovery of radioactivity? A) Marie Curie B) Wilhelm Rontgen C) Ernest Rutherford D) Niels Bohr (Ans: A)
Tip/Suggestion: Curie = 'cure'—her work on radioactivity led to medical treatments like cancer therapy.

Name: Robert Millikan
Contribution: Measured the charge of an electron through the oil drop experiment
Likely MCQ: Q: The charge of an electron was measured by: A) J.J. Thomson B) Robert Millikan C) Ernest Rutherford D) Niels Bohr (Ans: B)
Tip/Suggestion: Millikan = 'million'—his oil drop experiment measured a tiny charge, like a million small drops.

Name: Max Planck
Contribution: Introduced the quantum theory by proposing energy is emitted in quanta
Likely MCQ: Q: Who proposed that energy is emitted in discrete packets called quanta? A) Max Planck B) Albert Einstein C) Niels Bohr D) Werner Heisenberg (Ans: A)
Tip/Suggestion: Planck = 'plank'—he laid the foundational plank of quantum theory.

Name: Werner Heisenberg
Contribution: Formulated the uncertainty principle in quantum mechanics
Likely MCQ: Q: The uncertainty principle in quantum mechanics was proposed by: A) Max Planck B) Werner Heisenberg C) Albert Einstein D) Niels Bohr (Ans: B)
Tip/Suggestion: Heisenberg = 'hazy'—his uncertainty principle says you can’t be certain about position and momentum.

Name: Galileo Galilei
Contribution: Improved the telescope and made significant astronomical observations
Likely MCQ: Q: Who improved the telescope and discovered the moons of Jupiter? A) Galileo Galilei B) Johannes Kepler C) Isaac Newton D) Albert Einstein (Ans: A)
Tip/Suggestion: Galileo = 'galaxy'—he explored the skies and discovered Jupiter’s moons.

Name: Johannes Kepler
Contribution: Formulated the laws of planetary motion
Likely MCQ: Q: The laws of planetary motion were proposed by: A) Isaac Newton B) Johannes Kepler C) Galileo Galilei D) Albert Einstein (Ans: B)
Tip/Suggestion: Kepler = 'keeper'—he kept track of planetary orbits with his laws.

Name: Christiaan Huygens
Contribution: Proposed the wave theory of light
Likely MCQ: Q: Who proposed the wave theory of light? A) Christiaan Huygens B) Isaac Newton C) Thomas Young D) Albert Einstein (Ans: A)
Tip/Suggestion: Huygens = 'huge waves'—he proposed that light travels in waves.

Name: Thomas Young
Contribution: Demonstrated the wave nature of light through the double-slit experiment
Likely MCQ: Q: The double-slit experiment demonstrating light’s wave nature was conducted by: A) Thomas Young B) Christiaan Huygens C) Isaac Newton D) Albert Einstein (Ans: A)
Tip/Suggestion: Young = 'youth'—his youthful experiment showed light’s wave nature.

Name: Louis de Broglie
Contribution: Proposed the wave-particle duality of matter
Likely MCQ: Q: Who proposed that matter exhibits wave-particle duality? A) Louis de Broglie B) Werner Heisenberg C) Max Planck D) Niels Bohr (Ans: A)
Tip/Suggestion: De Broglie = 'bro wave'—he introduced the idea of matter waves.

Name: Edwin Hubble
Contribution: Discovered the expansion of the universe
Likely MCQ: Q: The expansion of the universe was discovered by: A) Edwin Hubble B) Albert Einstein C) Galileo Galilei D) Johannes Kepler (Ans: A)
Tip/Suggestion: Hubble = 'hubble bubble'—his discovery showed the universe is expanding like a bubble.

Name: James Prescott Joule
Contribution: Established the mechanical equivalent of heat
Likely MCQ: Q: Who established the relationship between mechanical work and heat? A) James Joule B) Michael Faraday C) James Maxwell D) Andre Ampere (Ans: A)
Tip/Suggestion: Joule = 'jewel'—his work on heat and work is a jewel of thermodynamics.

Name: Satyendra Nath Bose
Contribution: Developed the theory of Bose-Einstein statistics
Likely MCQ: Q: The scientist who developed the theory of Bose-Einstein statistics is: A) Satyendra Nath Bose B) Albert Einstein C) Max Planck D) Werner Heisenberg (Ans: A)
Tip/Suggestion: Bose = 'boss'—he’s the boss of quantum statistics for bosons.

Name: Enrico Fermi
Contribution: Developed the theory of beta decay and nuclear reactions
Likely MCQ: Q: Who developed the theory of beta decay in nuclear physics? A) Enrico Fermi B) Ernest Rutherford C) Marie Curie D) Niels Bohr (Ans: A)
Tip/Suggestion: Fermi = 'firm'—his work on nuclear reactions laid a firm foundation for nuclear physics.

Name: Arthur Compton
Contribution: Demonstrated the particle nature of light through the Compton effect
Likely MCQ: Q: The Compton effect, demonstrating the particle nature of light, was discovered by: A) Arthur Compton B) Albert Einstein C) Max Planck D) Thomas Young (Ans: A)
Tip/Suggestion: Compton = 'compact'—his effect compacted the idea of light as particles.
